instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_TMS: What is SMC_TMS? SMC_TMS is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TDO: What is SMC_TDO? SMC_TDO is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Got it working but will not turn on after SMC reset
threads.message:
Hello.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged corroded traces around SMC. The board was fucked up further by an idiot with a soldering iron.
Got the board working, reassembled the MacBook and did a clean install. SMC reset the machine and now does not power again.
Tried another trackpad and keyboard but still no power on. No sighns of corrosion any closer to the SMC than edge bonding.
It was working, now it don't.

Traces re-soldered:
<SIGNAL>SMC_TMS</SIGNAL> from <RESISTOR>R5177</RESISTOR> to SMC
<SIGNAL>SMC_TDO</SIGNAL> from <RESISTOR>R5178</RESISTOR> to SMC
<SIGNAL>SMC_INT_L</SIGNAL> from <RESISTOR>R5193</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Got it working but will not turn on after SMC reset
threads.message: i bet corrosion under the smc.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Got it working but will not turn on after SMC reset
threads.message:
Yeah, fucked if I'm jockeying that one right now....  Another day maybe.
You have a link to good SMC stencil or shall I open a thread in tools forum?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Got it working but will not turn on after SMC reset
threads.message: Just a bit of flux and heat on the SMC, do NOT reflow. Should be enough to clear the crap under it.
